description: [Status: preview] [Name: missing-copyright-notice] [Message: Missing copyright notice at top of file] What it does Checks for the absence of copyright notices within Python files. Note that this check only searches within the first 4096 bytes of the file. Why is this bad? In some codebases, it's common to have a license header at the top of every file. This rule ensures that the license header is present.

lint.flake8-copyright.author.option_description:
Author to enforce within the copyright notice. If provided, the
author must be present immediately following the copyright notice.



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.flake8-copyright]
author = "Ruff"



[lint.flake8-copyright]
author = "Ruff"

lint.flake8-copyright.min-file-size.option_description:
A minimum file size (in bytes) required for a copyright notice to
be enforced. By default, all files are validated.



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.flake8-copyright]
# Avoid enforcing a header on files smaller than 1024 bytes.
min-file-size = 1024



[lint.flake8-copyright]
# Avoid enforcing a header on files smaller than 1024 bytes.
min-file-size = 1024

lint.flake8-copyright.notice-rgx.option_description:
The regular expression used to match the copyright notice, compiled
with the regex crate.
Defaults to (?i)Copyright\s+((?:\(C\)|©)\s+)?\d{4}((-|,\s)\d{4})*, which matches
the following:

Copyright 2023
Copyright (C) 2023
Copyright 2021-2023
Copyright (C) 2021-2023
Copyright (C) 2021, 2023



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.flake8-copyright]
notice-rgx = "(?i)Copyright \\(C\\) \\d{4}"



[lint.flake8-copyright]
notice-rgx = "(?i)Copyright \\(C\\) \\d{4}"
